page.title: 08THE CUBS JUMBLE SALE
page.content: My name is Ewan.When I was seven I joined the cubs.Cubs were started to teach boys ways of looking after themselves out of doors.We learn knotting and make fires to cook our food and sometimes sleep in tents.Occasionally we need to raise money for funds and we have a jumble sale.I'll tell you about it. Cubs collect old clothes,books,china, and things people no longer need.We set out the jumble on tables in the village hall and then put big notices in the village telling the date of the sale.On sale day people queue up outside.We charge 20p entrance.Cubs and other helpers are waiting to serve.Sales can be exciting because there are lots of people anxious to buy things.I get quite dirty helping at jumble sales and afterwards need a hot bath.
